intro: Bactris manriquei, commonly known as the Manrique palm, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate leaves that can reach several meters in length. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible fruits that are similar in appearance to pineapples. Bactris manriquei is often found in wetland and swampy habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
